com.xilinx.rapidwright.design

Class DesignTools

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.design.DesignTools

  • public class DesignTools
extends Object
    A collection of methods to operate on Design objects. Created on: Dec 7, 2015

    • Method Detail

      • identifyClockSource

        public static SitePinInst identifyClockSource(SitePinInst netSource)
        Tries to identify the clock pin source for the given user signal output by tracing back to a FF within a SLICE. TODO - This method is not very robust.
        Parameters:
        netSource - The site pin output from which to start the clock search
        Returns:
        The source clock pin for the clock net or null if unable to determine one.

      • getClockDomain

        public static Net getClockDomain(Design d,
                                 String edifNet)

      • getDrivingCell

        public static Cell getDrivingCell(SitePinInst netSource)
        Tries to determine the driving cell within the site from the output site pin.
        Parameters:
        netSource - The output site pin from which to start searching
        Returns:
        The corresponding driving cell, or null if none could be found.

      • getDrivingBELPin

        public static BELPin getDrivingBELPin(SitePinInst netSource)
        Gets the originating driving element pin that corresponds to the given site pin.
        Parameters:
        netSource - The source pin
        Returns:
        The corresponding element pin or null if none could be found.

      • getDrivingBELPin

        public static BELPin getDrivingBELPin(BELPin elementPin)
        Gets the driving element pin of either a site port output or an element input pin.
        Parameters:
        elementPin - The element pin of interest. Cannot be a element output pin.
        Returns:
        The source element pin within the site for the given element pin.

      • getDrivenBELPins

        public static ArrayList<BELPin> getDrivenBELPins(BELPin elementPin)
        Gets the driven element pins of either a site port input or an element output pin.
        Parameters:
        elementPin - The element pin of interest. Cannot be an element input pin.
        Returns:
        A list of sink element pins within the site for the given element pin.

      • getCorrespondingRBELInputPin

        public static BELPin getCorrespondingRBELInputPin(BELPin outputPin,
                                                  SiteInst inst)
        Uses SitePIP information in the site instance to determine the driving input of the RBEL element output pin. There should only be one input that can affect the output and this method returns that input pin.
        Parameters:
        outputPin - The output pin on the RBEL element of interest.
        inst - The corresponding site instance where the pin resides.
        Returns:
        The driving input element pin on the RBEL, or null if none could be found.

      • getCorrespondingRBELOutputPin

        public static BELPin getCorrespondingRBELOutputPin(BELPin inputPin,
                                                   SiteInst inst)
        Returns the element's output pin corresponding that is being driven by the provided input pin.
        Parameters:
        inputPin - The input pin of interest
        inst - The site instance corresponding to the element of interest
        Returns:
        The element's output pin that is driven by the provided input pin.

      • areAllPinsConnectedToALUT

        public static boolean areAllPinsConnectedToALUT(Net n)
        Determines if all the pins connected to this net connect to only LUTs
        Returns:
        True if all pins connect only to LUTs, false otherwise.

      • optimizeLUT1Inverters

        public static void optimizeLUT1Inverters(Design design)

      • createPinAndAddToNet

        public static SitePinInst createPinAndAddToNet(Cell cell,
                                               String cellPinName,
                                               Net net)
        Creates a new pin on a site connected to the cell pin and also adds it to the provided net. Updates both logical and physical netlist representations. Note: If the site pin being added is an output it will displace any existing output source on the given net.
        Parameters:
        cell - The placed source or sink BEL instance from which to trace to a site pin. Must have a direct connection to a site pin.
        cellPinName - Name of the logical pin name on the cell.
        net - The net to add the pin to.
        Returns:
        The newly created pin that has been added to net

      • calculateUtilization

        public static HashMap<UtilizationType,Integer> calculateUtilization(Design d)

      • writeVerilogStub

        public static void writeVerilogStub(Design design,
                                    String fileName)
        Creates a verilog wrapper file for this design by examining the top level netlist.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Name of the desired verilog file.

      • toCSV

        public static void toCSV(String fileName,
                         Design design)
        Creates two CSV files based on this design, one for instances and one for nets.
        Parameters:
        fileName -

      • findRoutingPath

        public static List<PIP> findRoutingPath(Node start,
                                        Node end)
        Demonstrates a rudimentary path expansion for finding a routing path in the interconnect.
        Parameters:
        start - Desired start node
        end - Desired end node
        Returns:
        A list of PIPs that configure a path from start to end nodes, or null if a path could not be found.

      • findRoutingPath

        public static List<PIP> findRoutingPath(RouteNode start,
                                        RouteNode end)
        Demonstrates a rudimentary path expansion for finding a routing path in the interconnect.
        Parameters:
        start - Desired start node
        end - Desired end node
        Returns:
        A list of PIPs that configure a path from start to end nodes, or null if a path could not be found.

      • resolveNetNameFromSiteWire

        public static String resolveNetNameFromSiteWire(SiteInst inst,
                                                int siteWire)
        Examines a site wire in a populated site inst for all the connected BELPins for cells occupying those BELs. It attempts to lookup the net attached to the cell pin in order to find the hierarchical parent net name of the net and returns its name.
        Parameters:
        inst - The site instance where the site wire in question resides.
        siteWire - The site wire index in the site where the site inst resides.
        Returns:
        The hierarchical parent net name using the site wire or null if none could be found.

      • populateBlackBox

        public static void populateBlackBox(Design design,
                                    String hierarchicalCellName,
                                    Design cell)
        NOTE: This method is not fully tested. Populates a black box in a netlist with the provided design. This method most closely resembles the Vivado command 'read_checkpoint -cell .
        Parameters:
        design - The top level design
        hierarchicalCellName - Name of the black box in the design netlist.
        cell - The 'guts' to be inserted into the black box

      • postBlackBoxCleanup

        public static void postBlackBoxCleanup(String hierCellName,
                                       Design design)
        Attempts to rename boundary nets around the previous blackbox to follow naming convention (net is named after source).
        Parameters:
        hierCellName - The hierarchical cell instance that was previously a black box
        design - The current design.

      • getNodePIPMap

        public static Map<Node,ArrayList<PIP>> getNodePIPMap(List<PIP> route)
        Creates a map from Node to a list of PIPs for a given list of PIPs (likely from the routing of a net).
        Parameters:
        route - The list of PIPs to create the map from.
        Returns:
        The map of all involved nodes to their respectively connected PIPs.

      • removeConnectedRouting

        public static boolean removeConnectedRouting(Net net,
                                             Node node)
        Examines the routing of a net and will remove all parts of the routing that connect to the provided node. This is most useful when attempting to unroute parts of a static (VCC/GND) net that have multiple sources.
        Parameters:
        net - The net with potential disjoint routing trees
        node - Node belonging to the routing tree to remove.
        Returns:
        True if PIPs were removed, false otherwise

      • makeBlackBox

        public static void makeBlackBox(Design d,
                                String hierarchicalCellName)
        Turns the cell named hierarchicalCellName into a blackbox and removes any associated placement and routing information associated with that instance. In Vivado, this can be accomplished by running: (1) 'update_design -cells -black_box' or (2) by deleting all of the cells and nets insides of a cell instance. Method (2) is more likely to have complications.
        Parameters:
        d - The current design
        hierarchicalCellName - The name of the hierarchical cell to become a black box.

      • getCorrespondingSiteInst

        public static SiteInst getCorrespondingSiteInst(Design design,
                                                SiteInst orig,
                                                Site newAnchor,
                                                Module module)
        Gets or creates the corresponding SiteInst from the prototype orig from a module.
        Parameters:
        design - The current design from which to get the corresponding site instance.
        orig - The original site instance (from the module)
        newAnchor - The new anchor location of the module.
        module - The Module to use as the template.
        Returns:
        The corresponding SiteInst from design if it exists, or a newly created one in the translated location. If the new location cannot be determined or is invalid, null is returned.

      • stampPlacement

        public static boolean stampPlacement(Design design,
                                     Module stamp,
                                     Map<String,Site> instPlacements)
        Given a design with multiple identical cell instances, place each of those instances using the stamp module template at the anchored site locations provided in instPlacements.
        Parameters:
        design - The top level design with identical multiple cell instances.
        stamp - The prototype stamp (or stencil) to use for replicated placement and routing. This must match identically with the named instances in instPlacements
        instPlacements -
        Returns:
        True if the procedure completed successfully, false otherwise.

      • getConnectedCells

        public static Set<Cell> getConnectedCells(SitePinInst pin)
        Looks in the site instance for cells connected to this site pin.
        Returns:
        List of connected cells to this pin

      • placeCell

        public static boolean placeCell(Cell c,
                                Design design)
        Quick and dumb placement of a cell. Does not attempt any optimization and will not change the placement of other cells. Currently it will only place a cell in an empty site. If the cell is already placed, it will leave it as is. TODO - implement basic optimizations
        Parameters:
        c - The cell to place
        Returns:
        True if the cell is successfully placed, false otherwise.

      • createMissingSitePinInsts

        public static List<SitePinInst> createMissingSitePinInsts(Design design,
                                                          Net net)
        Creates any and all missing SitePinInsts for this net. This is common as a placed DCP will not have SitePinInsts annotated and this information is generally necessary for routing to take place.
        Parameters:
        design - The current design of this net.
        Returns:
        The list of pins that were created or an empty list if none were created.

      • getRoutedSitePin

        public static String getRoutedSitePin(Cell cell,
                                      Net net,
                                      String logicalPinName)
        Gets the site pin that is currently routed to the specified cell pin. If the site instance is not routed, it will return null. Side Effect: It will set alternative source site pins on the net if present.
        Parameters:
        cell - The cell with the pin of interest.
        net - The physical net to which this pin belongs
        logicalPinName - The logical pin name of the cell to query.
        Returns:
        The name of the site pin on the cell's site to which the pin is routed.

      • createMissingSitePinInsts

        public static void createMissingSitePinInsts(Design design)
        Creates all missing SitePinInsts in a design. See also DesignTools.createMissingSitePinInsts(Design, Net)
        Parameters:
        design - The current design

      • unrouteDualOutputSitePinRouting

        public static void unrouteDualOutputSitePinRouting(Design design)
        In Series7 and UltraScale architectures, there are dual output site pin scenarios where an optional additional output can be used to drive out of the SLICE using the OUTMUX routing BEL. When unrouting a design, some site routing can be left "dangling". This method will remove those unnecessary sitePIPs and site routing for the *MUX output. It will also remove the output source pin if it is the *MUX output.
        Parameters:
        design - The design from which to remove the unnecessary site routing

      • getLegalAlternativeOutputPin

        public static SitePinInst getLegalAlternativeOutputPin(Net net)
        Finds a legal/available alternative output site pin for the given net. The most common case is the SLICE. It depends on the existing output pin of the net to be routed within the site and checks if site routing resource are available to use the alternative output site pin.
        Parameters:
        net - The net of interest.
        Returns:
        A new potential site pin inst that could be added/routed to.

      • getLogicalBELPinDriver

        public static BELPin getLogicalBELPinDriver(SitePinInst sitePinInst)
        Looks backwards from a SitePinInst output pin and finds the corresponding BELPin of the driver.
        Parameters:
        sitePinInst - The output site pin instance from which to find the logical driver.
        Returns:
        The logical driver's BELPin of the provided sitePinInst.

      • routeAlternativeOutputSitePin

        public static boolean routeAlternativeOutputSitePin(Net net,
                                                    SitePinInst sitePinInst)
        Routes (within the site) the alternate site output pin for SLICE dual-output scenarios.
        Parameters:
        net - The current net of interest to be routed
        sitePinInst - The alternate site output pin to be routed
        Returns:
        True if the routing was successful, false otherwise

      • unrouteAlternativeOutputSitePin

        public static boolean unrouteAlternativeOutputSitePin(Net net)
        Un-routes (within the site) the alternate source pin on the provided net. This is in reference to dual-output site pin scenarios for SLICEs.
        Parameters:
        net - The relevant net that has the populated alternative site pin.
        Returns:
        True if the alternate source was unrouted successfully, false otherwise.

      • getPortInstsFromSitePinInst

        public static ArrayList<EDIFHierPortInst> getPortInstsFromSitePinInst(SitePinInst sitePin)
        Given a SitePinInst, this method will find any return hierarchical logical cell pins within the site directly connected to the site pin.
        Parameters:
        sitePin - The site pin to query.
        Returns:
        A list of hierarchical port instances that connect to the site pin.
